messages.content: ComfyUI-TeaNodes is a collection of custom nodes that extend the functionality of ComfyUI, a graphical user interface that uses the Stable Diffusion model to generate images and videos.
What does the Image Equalization CLAHE node do in ComfyUI-TeaNodes?

The Image Equalization CLAHE node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes smoothly distributes the histogram of an image, making it easier for the ControlNet preprocessor to process the image, especially when the background of the image is removed.
How does the Image Size Approximation node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes work?

The Image Size Approximation node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes works by using a pixel count that retains the image ratio. This algorithm is not very sophisticated, but it is effective and helps stabilize the speed of image-to-image generation.
What is the purpose of the Image Resize node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes?

The Image Resize node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes resizes an image based on the size tuple received from the Size Approximation Node. It simplifies the resizing process by using a node socket instead of converting it into input from a widget.
What does the Image Scale node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes do?

The Image Scale node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes multiplies the image size by a factor. As of the 20240425 update, it scales smoothly when multiplied by non-power-of-2 factors using the LANCZOS option, making it easier to save in-process scrap images at half or quarter resolution.
How does the Crop To node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes help with image processing?
The Crop To node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes crops an image to the same size as the reference image, eliminating issues with nodes that complain about bad tensor dimensions.
What is the KorniaGamma node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes used for?
The KorniaGamma node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes is used for adjusting the brightness, contrast, and levels of an image. It is a powerful tool that utilizes image processing capabilities for better results.
What does the Random & Non-Random Color Fill node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes do?

The Random & Non-Random Color Fill node in ComfyUI-TeaNodes fills an area based on the reference image size. The randomness is defined by the original color and a variance in hue, saturation, and value. The color input field works with most color string formats.
